results.title: The ameliorating effects of metformin on disarrangement ongoing in gastrocnemius muscle of sarcopenic and obese sarcopenic mice.
results.journal: Biochim Biophys Acta Mol Basis Dis
results.text_hl: The significant up-regulated mRNA and protein level of lipolysis related proteins like @GENE_LIPE @GENE_16890 @@@hormone-sensitive lipase@@@ (@GENE_LIPE @GENE_16890 @@@HSL@@@) and @GENE_PNPLA2 @GENE_66853 @@@adipose triglyceride lipase@@@ (@GENE_PNPLA2 @GENE_66853 @@@ATGL@@@) may contribute to the ameliorated @<m>DISEASE_Hypothyroidism_Congenital_Nongoitrous_2</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566852 @@@ectopic@@@ lipid deposition with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ intervention.

citations.NLM: Lyu Q, Wen Y, He B, Zhang X, Chen J, Sun Y, Zhao Y, Xu L, Xiao Q, Deng H. The ameliorating effects of metformin on disarrangement ongoing in gastrocnemius muscle of sarcopenic and obese sarcopenic mice. Biochim Biophys Acta Mol Basis Dis. 2022 Nov 1;1868(11):166508. PMID: 35905940
citations.BibTeX: @article{35905940, title={The ameliorating effects of metformin on disarrangement ongoing in gastrocnemius muscle of sarcopenic and obese sarcopenic mice.}, author={Lyu Q and Wen Y and He B and Zhang X and Chen J and Sun Y and Zhao Y and Xu L and Xiao Q and Deng H}, journal={Biochim Biophys Acta Mol Basis Dis}, volume={1868}, number={11}, pages={166508}}

results.title: Comparative Proteomic Analysis Reveals Metformin Improves the Expression of Biomarkers of Endometrial Receptivity in Infertile Women with Minimal/Mild Endometriosis.
results.text_hl: The prevalence of @DISEASE_Endometriosis @DISEASE_MESH:D004715 @@@endometriosis@@@ is approximately 10% in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ of reproductive age, and 30-50% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Endometriosis @DISEASE_MESH:D004715 @@@endometriosis@@@ are infertile. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has been reported to inhibit the growth of @<m>DISEASE_Hypothyroidism_Congenital_Nongoitrous_2</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C566852 @@@ectopic lesions@@@ in @DISEASE_Endometriosis @DISEASE_MESH:D004715 @@@endometriosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Huang X, Xiao L, Long Y, Pei T, Luo B, Liao T, Li Y, Zhu H, Ouyang Y, Huang W. Comparative Proteomic Analysis Reveals Metformin Improves the Expression of Biomarkers of Endometrial Receptivity in Infertile Women with Minimal/Mild Endometriosis. Reprod Sci. 2022 Sep;29(9):2593-2606. PMID: 35088363
